Package io.github.asdfjkl.jchesslib

Class Game

java.lang.Object
io.github.asdfjkl.jchesslib.Game
public class Game extends Object
Class to store Games. This includes both the actual game tree consisting of GameNode's, as well as meta-information such as the PGN header information

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    Game()
    create a new game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      create a new game. The game will have a root node with an empty board and no pgn headers.

  • Method Details

    • containsPosition

      public boolean containsPosition(long positionHash, int minHalfmove, int maxHalfmove)
      Given a position hash (similar to a zobrist hash, but without turn or castling rights encoded), this functions search the game tree recursively and will return true if a position appears in the tree
      Parameters:
      positionHash - the position to look for
      minHalfmove - search only game nodes that are at least a number of halfmoves from root
      maxHalfmove - search only game nodes that are at most a number of halfmoves from root
      Returns:
      true if a position was found, false otherwise

    • findNodeById

      public GameNode findNodeById(int id)
      Each node has a unique id associated that is created upon creating the node. Given an id, find the node in the game tree that belongs to that id
      Parameters:
      id - the id of a node
      Returns:
      the game node if found, throws IllegalArgumentException if a node with that id does not exist

    • getAllIds

      public ArrayList<Integer> getAllIds()
      Get a list of all id's of all nodes that are in the game tree
      Returns:
      contains all the id's

    • isTreeChanged

      public boolean isTreeChanged()
      checks if the flag treeWasChanged is set.
      Returns:
      true if the flag is set, false otherwise

    • setTreeWasChanged

      public void setTreeWasChanged(boolean status)
      sets the flag treeWasChanged. This flag can be used to track changes of the game tree and use the information to re-render the game tree in a graphical user interface
      Parameters:
      status - indicating if tree was changed

    • isHeaderChanged

      public boolean isHeaderChanged()
      checks if the flag headerWasChanged is set.
      Returns:
      true if the flag is set, false otherwise

    • setHeaderWasChanged

      public void setHeaderWasChanged(boolean state)
      sets the flag headerWasChanged. This flag can be used to track changes of the meta-information of the game and use that info to re-render the meta-information in a graphical user interface
      Parameters:
      state - indicating if header was changed

    • setHeader

      public void setHeader(String tag, String value)
      sets meta-information of the game
      Parameters:
      tag - e.g. 'Site'
      value - e.g. 'London'

    • getHeader

      public String getHeader(String tag)
      returns meta-information of the game. Will return empty string if the information is not available
      Parameters:
      tag - e.g. 'Site'
      Returns:
      the value of the tag, e.g. 'London'

    • resetHeaders

      public void resetHeaders()
      reset all meta-information

    • getTags

      public ArrayList<String> getTags()
      return all meta-information (tags)
      Returns:
      e.g. ['Site', 'Event', ... ]

    • getPgnHeaders

      public HashMap<String,String> getPgnHeaders()
      return all meta-information (tag + header)
      Returns:
      hashmap of key,value e.g. key="Site", value="London"

    • setPgnHeaders

      public void setPgnHeaders(HashMap<String,String> pgnHeaders)
      set all pgn headers.
      Parameters:
      pgnHeaders - must contain keys of tags, and values of tag-values

    • getRootNode

      public GameNode getRootNode()
      get the root node of the game
      Returns:

    • getEndNode

      public GameNode getEndNode()
      get the leaf node of the game (seen from root, traversing the main variation)
      Returns:

    • getCurrentNode

      public GameNode getCurrentNode()
      return the currently selected node
      Returns:

    • getResult

      public int getResult()
      return the result of the game
      Returns:
      one of {code CONSTANTS.RES_*}

    • setResult

      public void setResult(int r)
      set the result of the game
      Parameters:
      r - one of {code CONSTANTS.RES_*}

    • applyMove

      public void applyMove(Move m)
      apply a move. a new variation is generated, and the currently selected node is set to newly generated move. If the move already exists, then the currently selected node is set to the corresponding variation (i.e. child node). This does not check move legality, and will raise an error. Check the legality of the move before calling this method
      Parameters:
      m - the move to apply

    • setCurrent

      public void setCurrent(GameNode newCurrent)
      sets the currently selected node
      Parameters:
      newCurrent - the node to select

    • setRoot

      public void setRoot(GameNode newRoot)
      (re)sets the root node of the game
      Parameters:
      newRoot - the new root node

    • goToMainLineChild

      public void goToMainLineChild()
      move the currently selected move down to the child node of the main variation. This has no effect if we are already at a leaf node

    • goToChild

      public void goToChild(int idxChild)
      move the currently selected move down to the child node of variation with the supplied index (starting from 0 for the main variation). No effect, if such a variation does not exist
      Parameters:
      idxChild -

    • goToParent

      public void goToParent()
      move the currently selected node to the parent. no effect if we are at the root node

    • goToRoot

      public void goToRoot()
      move the currently selected node to the root node

    • goToEnd

      public void goToEnd()
      move the currently selected node to the leaf node of the main variation (seen from the root)

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp(GameNode node)
      move the variation of the supplied game node one up (i.e. variation 2 becomes variation 1). No effect if the variation is already the main (0-th) variation
      Parameters:
      node - the start of the variation that should be moved up

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown(GameNode node)
      move the variation of the supplied game node one down (i.e. variation 1 becomes variation 2). No effect if the variation is already the last variation
      Parameters:
      node -

    • delVariant

      public void delVariant(GameNode node)
      remove the variation that with the supplied game node. This will traverse the tree up until the start of the variation that contains the supplied node
      Parameters:
      node - the game node where the variation starts.

    • delBelow

      public void delBelow(GameNode node)
      remove all variations below the one that is supplied
      Parameters:
      node -

    • removeCommentRec

      public void removeCommentRec(GameNode node)
      remove all comments in the supplied game node and all nodes in all variations below
      Parameters:
      node -

    • removeAllComments

      public void removeAllComments()
      remove all comments in the game

    • goToLeaf

      public void goToLeaf()
      move the currently selected node down to a leaf node. This will start from the currently selected node and always chose the main line

    • removeAllAnnotationsRec

      public void removeAllAnnotationsRec(GameNode node)
      remove all annotation information (i.e. NAG) in the supplied node and all nodes of all variations below
      Parameters:
      node -

    • removeAllAnnotations

      public void removeAllAnnotations()
      remove all annotations (i.e. NAGs) in the game

    • resetWithNewRootBoard

      public void resetWithNewRootBoard(Board newRootBoard)
      reset the game tree, in particular create a new root node and set the supplied board as the position of that root
      Parameters:
      newRootBoard -

    • removeAllVariants

      public void removeAllVariants()
      remove all variations of the game, only keep the main line

    • clearHeaders

      public void clearHeaders()
      clear the seven mandatory PGN headers

    • countHalfmoves

      public int countHalfmoves()
      count the number of halfmoves from the root to the leaf of the main variation
      Returns:

    • isThreefoldRepetition

      public boolean isThreefoldRepetition()
      checks if a three-fold repetition occurend inbetween the root and the currently selected node
      Returns:
      true if a three-fold repetition occurred, false otherwise

    • isInsufficientMaterial

      public boolean isInsufficientMaterial()
      checks if there is sufficient material to mate in the currently selected node
      Returns:
      true if there is insufficient material, false otherwise
